page.title: 15COMMUTERS DAY FROM HERNE BAY
page.content: Commuting to London normally involves catching a train at about 7.30 a.m. and arriving back in Herne Bay at about 7 p.m.. Usually the procedure involves transport to and from Herne Bay Station and also transport to work once in London. With the strikes and mechanical failures which afflict the railways, added to the physical and mental tiredness of a long day this can be very stressful. The greater job opportunities offered in London plus the higher saleries are some compensation. However in recent years the cost of rail travel has risen greatly so that the daily Herne Bay to London journey now costs over Â£1000 and now many commuters are more prepared to look for a local job even though this may entail a drop in salery.
